column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 161059953669 "2017-05-25 15:28:05 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/161059953669/the-god-pharaohs-gift "vorthosjay: The card Gate to the Afterlife gives us some strong hints at Nicol Bolas’ plans for Amonkhet. It references another card
column2: named God-Pharaoh’s Gift
column3: that has yet to be printed. With the clues we’ve been given so far
column5: I think we can figure it out what Bolas is up to
column6: and what his ‘Gift’ might be. Loyal Retainers by Bastien L. Deharme Let’s break down Gate to the Afterlife into its flavor parts. The triggered ability gains you life and lets you loot whenever a non-token creature you control dies. The activated ability can only be used once enough creatures have died.  “Birth and death are both reversible.”—Nicol Bolas (Soul Manipulation)  From a flavor perspective
column7: it’s clear that Bolas’ goal is centered around the dead on Amonkhet. He’s not looking for living Worthy or minions. He wants the people of Amonkhet to die
column8: but he wants them to be in the best possible shape before that happens. So what is Bolas’ end game? The clue is located in The Hand That Moves
column9: from one of Nissa’s visions:   Giants
column11: stomping through streets.    Metallic blue giants? I think I know what’s happening. Let’s talk about Lazotep. Keep reading  This was fun to talk about. There’s some variables here I’m not sure of
column12: but Jay can run with whatever he likes in his own articles. :-) Either way
column13: it’s been clear that lazotep is much more important than Amonkhet signals. We get lots of clues and implications
column14: but we don’t quite yet know the picture this puzzle is creating." False text

column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160989433447 "2017-05-23 17:00:35 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160989433447/arbitrary-card-of-the-day-5-23-17-guiding-spirit "Today’s arbitrary card of the day is Guiding Spirit. There was a time when the order of your graveyard mattered. column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160952490130 "2017-05-22 17:00:34 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160952490130/arbitrary-card-of-the-day-5-22-17-mistmeadow "Today’s arbitrary card of the day is Mistmeadow Witch. While art is useful for setting a plane’s mood
column2: words are also a powerful tool to build worlds. For example
column3: Shadowmoor is supposed to be this twisted nightmare version of happy-go-lucky Lorwyn. If you want your world to seem scary
column4: every color has to feel darker than normal. Witches fall into Black on most planes
column5: but having one show up in White/Blue helps convey Shadowmoor’s distorted tone." True text

column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160947614941 "2017-05-22 14:00:26 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160947614941/game-day-haven "For the first time in a year
column2: I played a Standard deck without any Eldrazi in it.This past weekend was Amonkhet Game Day
column3: a chance to prove yourself a Worthy Champion in Magic’s premier constructed format. I always use Game Day as a chance to brew a sweet deck and see how it holds up in actual matches. This time
column4: there was one card able to tear me away from Eldrazi: Drake Haven.Here’s the list I settled on:Creatures (4):4 Torrential GearhulkInstants (24):4 Magma Spray3 Lightning Axe4 Censor2 Pull from Tomorrow2 Disallow4 Fiery Temper2 Hieroglyphic Illumination3 Commit to MemorySorceries (3):3 Cathartic ReunionEnchantments (3):3 Drake HavenLands (26):2 Geier Reach Sanitarium4 Spirebluff Canal4 Wandering Fumarole8 Island8 MountainSideboard (15):2 Release the Gremlins4 Thing in the Ice3 Negate3 Sweltering Suns1 Chandra
column5: Flamecaller2 Sphinx of the Final WordGotta Love the DrakeDrake Haven by John Severin BrassellDraken Haven is a resilient engine that churns out far more power/toughness than the mana you put into it. If your deck is discarding cards anyway
column6: Drake Haven turns all those actions into 2/2 fliers. Whenever you discard multiple cards at once
column7: each one produces a separate trigger as well. So discard three cards
column8: make three Drakes.The trick is to build a deck that wants to be discarding cards. I had four different versions in the works. I settled on the controlling Blue/Red version because it was the best one when I didn’t have a Drake Haven. Even if I’m not pumping out Drakes
column9: this deck can largely play like a UR Control deck.That’s the Power of LoveCathartic Reunion by Dawn MurinAlmost every nonland card in this deck can fuel Drake Haven. There are two classes of these spells: cyclers and cards that discard other cards.Censor and Hieroglyphic Illumination are the cyclers. Each cycles for only one Blue mana
column10: meaning they can create a 2/2 flier and draw a card for only two mana. That’s an incredible return on your mana. Censor
column12: is also just an excellent early-game counterspell. It helps keep curve-out decks in check to give mine time to deploy Drake Haven. This deck holds a lot of mana up and mostly plays on the opponent’s turn
column13: so cards like Hieroglyphic Illumination that can generate an advantage on their end step are exactly what I need.The other discard spells each play an important role. Like Hieroglyphic Illumination
column14: Pull through Time is great for drawing cards on end step. I split both cards because Pull is better on its own
column15: but Illumination can be cast off of Torrential Gearhulk. The card is perfect even if you aren’t leveraging the discard action
column16: but even better when you are. Cathartic Reunion is more discard for less mana. With Haven out
column17: this spell draws three cards and creates two Drakes for only four mana. Finally
column18: Lightning Axe is the removal spell for big creatures. It’s also only one mana
column19: making it incredibly efficient. It’s also an instant that can be cast off of the Gearhulk. It can also just be cast for six mana (which I did once this weekend). Finally
column20: Geier Reach Sanitarium’s symmetry gets broken when you’re the one creating Drakes. It’s also just good for getting rid of excess lands.Magma Spray is just a premium removal spell in Standard right now. Commit to Memory and Disallow are part of the control package. If you’re discarding tons of cards
column21: Torrential Gearhulk is even better. Sneakily
column22: it can also cast Memory out of the graveyard to give you access to a fresh hand before your opponent.SideboredomRelease the Gremlins by IzzySideboards are always tricky. You want to use them to swing post-board matchups in your favor.My deck’s biggest weakness is aggressive decks (My only loss was to a GW deck that enjoyed turning creatures sideways.) Sweltering Suns is excellent there. An aggressive deck may also side out removal against me
column23: so bringing in Thing in the Ice to block
column25: and end the game also helps. Chandra
column28: while also diversifying my threats against midrange and control (Her 0 ability can also create a lottt of Drakes.) I actually ended up siding out Drake Haven in my aggro matchups. There just isn’t time to deploy it
column29: and Gearhulk is enough to win.Control matchups are also tricky. My main board has some cards that are AWFUL against control
column30: like Magma Spray and Lightning Axe. Negate and Sphinx of the Final Word are much better.Release the Gremlins is great against decks with artifacts
column31: removing their cards and giving me Gremlin tokens. I got to face an artifact deck
column32: and was happy to have those lil’ snoots fighting alongside my Gearhulks.Game Day Trial CompleteI ended up coming in second place
column33: earning myself a coveted Glorybringer promo. This deck was a blast to play
column34: but I have a confession to make. Drake Haven wasn’t very good. It was too slow against the fast decks and wasn’t always necessary to beat the slower decks. I think it’s a fine sideboard card in some matchups
column35: but more often than not I think I’d rather have the Sweltering Suns in the first game. Then I’m just in UR Control. This isn’t bad
column36: but I think my brewing and playing has me convinced that Drake Haven might not be worth building around.Also
column37: Torrential Gearhulk is a hell of a card.Until next time
column39: may your battle strategies evolve with every victory." True text

column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160772230882 "2017-05-17 17:00:16 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160772230882/arbitrary-card-of-the-day-5-17-17-jötun-owl "Today’s arbitrary card of the day is Jötun Owl Keeper. While the frost giants of Norse myth get a bad rap in modern pop culture

column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160772012099 "2017-05-17 16:51:50 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160772012099/play-design "markrosewater: Several weeks ago
column2: I said that we were taking steps to improve the processes behind the scenes in R&D to ensure that we don’t repeat some of our mistakes of the last year. I’m happy today to talk about one of these changes – the creation of a new group within R&D called Play Design.  The purpose of Play Design is to be a group solely dedicated to the health of tournament environments
column3: to make sure that playing Magic in structured settings is as enjoyable as possible. This will
column5: impact the quality of these formats even for players playing outside of tournaments. We recently hired Dan Burdick to run this team and are currently staffing it up. This has included moving current R&D members onto the team as well as converting two of our playtesters (welcome Pro Tour 8’ers Melissa DeTora and Andrew Brown) into fulltime employees. We are also looking for additional experienced players outside of Wizards to bring onto the team. Besides having a team solely focused on this task
column6: we’re also changing how we build sets from the ground up to make sure that Play Design is involved at every step. Design
column8: will be working with Play Design to make sure that we are creating mechanics that can be properly balanced. Dan is just settling in
column9: but he’ll be writing an article (appearing in June
column10: I believe) that will formally introduce the team and explain its philosophy. " False text

column1: sarpadianempiresvol-viii 160736304084 "2017-05-16 17:00:33 GMT" http://sarpadianempiresvol-viii.tumblr.com/post/160736304084/arbitrary-card-of-the-day-5-16-17-simulacrum "Today’s arbitrary card of the day is Simulacrum. This is a neat flavor. “Turns out you were only attacking my double!” *punches you in the face* But you know
column2: more magical. This probably wouldn’t be a Black effect today. Maybe White/Black or Red/White could do it. Because this isn’t an immediate damage redirection
column3: and that damage doesn’t *have* to come from an opponent
column4: I don’t think it can be done in mono-White.It’s also cute with Volcano Hellion if you don’t mind losing the Hellion." True text

A real art exhibition is being organized and I have over 80 paintings and more concept art than I should own to showcase. This is a four-room
column2: full art show and will be free to everyone at Grand Prix Las Vegas this June. What if you can’t make it? We will have a virtual tour for $5. What if you can’t afford to fund it? Promote it like hell.  This is to build the process to do *more* art shows
column3: different planes and different themes in the future. It’s almost like we have stretch goals that will do that…  And here are a few artworks that will be in it
